Ad Text:
Senior Strategic Implementation Business Analyst (S/4HANA | Procurement | Defence ERP)

Melbourne | Full-time | Baseline clearance (with ability to gain NV1)

The opportunity

We are excited to parter with our long term client in recruiting this Senior Strategic Business Analyst Role in Defence

Join a high-impact Defence ERP program supporting commercial and procurement outcomes across a complex stakeholder environment. This is a senior BA role for someone who can translate strategic intent into practical delivery—building the operating rhythm, artefacts, and knowledge base that enable teams to adopt and continuously improve in an S/4HANA environment.

You’ll be trusted with autonomy, exposed to senior decision-makers, and positioned at the centre of the procure-to-pay value chain.

What you’ll be doing

Build and manage a forward work plan to deliver a commercial/procurement strategic roadmap

Translate strategy into operational artefacts and actionable deliverables for delivery teams

Develop and maintain a structured information framework (processes, policies, knowledge articles) to support a scalable knowledge base

Support operating model uplift: ways of working, governance, KPIs, and decision pathways

Drive end-to-end process integration across stakeholders to ensure procurement workflows connect cleanly to upstream/downstream functions

Produce evidence-based advisory packs that enable confident strategic decisions

Lead investigations and analysis to define business requirements for ongoing system upgrades and enhancements

Improve business processes through mapping, controls, and practical recommendations

Support adoption by identifying and uplifting process, policy, and training needs

What you’ll bring (must-have)

Hands-on, transactional experience navigating SAP S/4HANA in a business-facing capacity

Strong background in procurement/commercial processes (procure-to-pay experience highly valued)

Confidence engaging senior stakeholders and leading workshops, decisions, and outcomes

Strong written and verbal communication—able to produce clear artefacts that teams actually use

Comfortable working autonomously, prioritising effectively, and delivering without heavy supervision

Nice to have

Experience in Defence, government, or other highly regulated environments

Exposure to S/4HANA procurement/commercial modules and integration points

Experience building knowledge frameworks (SOPs, playbooks, process libraries) and driving adoption

Why you’ll want this role

High trust + high autonomy: own your workstream and shape outcomes

Work that matters: improve procurement and commercial performance through better processes and system adoption

Strong career growth with development support and opportunities to step into broader leadership roles

Multi-award-winning, ASX-listed lending organisation with $20B+ in assets under management.

This newly created role offers end-to-end ownership, business-facing impact, and a path to Principal Data Scientist or leadership.

What’s on Offer
•    $200k+ base + Super + Performance Bonus
•    Hybrid working flexibility
•    Join a high-performing, collaborative team of Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and AI Engineers
•    Work with bleeding-edge technology: Snowflake, dbt, Python, Azure ML, Streamlit, Generative AI
•    High visibility role directly influencing P&L and customer strategy
•    Career-enhancing experience on retention, pricing, sales, and credit initiatives

The Role
•    Build and deploy customer retention and predictive models
•    Design and lead experimentation and A/B testing frameworks
•    Productionise models into Azure ML environments and develop scalable ML pipelines
•    Build monitoring and visualization tools for stakeholders (Streamlit)
•    Collaborate with senior leaders to shape strategy and influence key business decisions

Technology Environment
•    Snowflake – enterprise data storage
•    dbt – transformation and analytics engineering
•    Python – model development, feature engineering
•    Azure ML – batch & real-time deployment
•    Azure DevOps – CI/CD and version control
•    Streamlit – monitoring and business-facing applications
•    Azure AI / Generative AI – integrated in ML workflows

About You
•    Strong commercial Data Science experience in a corporate environment
•    Advanced Python & SQL skills
•    Cloud deployment experience 

Bonus

• Experience in experimentation, modelling, and delivering measurable business outcomes
• Bachelor’s or higher in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or similar

• Experience in Snowflake, dbt
• Experience in Lending or Credit Risk

This role offers breadth, visibility, and real commercial impact, making it a career-defining opportunity for a senior Data Scientist ready to grow into leadership.


Apply now to work with a talented, collaborative team on cutting-edge Data Science initiatives.

For a confidential discussion please text Anna-Maria on 0426 503 822 with your name and position title, I will get back to you to discuss.

About Us
Terra Firma is a highly respected Australian business and technology consulting firm with a 30-year history of successfully delivering client outcomes. We offer leading business and technology consulting services covering the entire lifecycle of a program. We offer you exposure to a diverse array of clients across various industries including all levels of Government, Banking and Financial Services, Not for Profit, Telcos, Technology and Utilities.


The Opportunity

Expression of Interest – Change Analysts
We are anticipating several upcoming requirements for experienced Change Analysts to support technology and business transformation programs across a range of leading Australian organisations. These will either be contract or permanent engagements with hybrid working arrangements and the potential for extensions.

If you are an adaptable and proactive Change Analyst interested in being considered for future opportunities, we would welcome your Expression of Interest.




What You’ll Typically Work On

Supporting the delivery of change activities across technology and business transformation programs

Preparing change artefacts such as impact assessments, stakeholder analyses, communications, and training material

Partnering with Change Leads, Project Managers, SMEs, and broader program teams

Coordinating engagement activities including workshops, briefings, and readiness checks

Maintaining documentation, tracking actions, and supporting adoption activities across complex environments

Contributing to implementation planning, user readiness, and post-go-live reviews

About You

Experience delivering or supporting change across technology programs

Exposure to multiple industries or organisational settings (e.g., Financial Services, Government, Higher Education, Utilities, Corporate)

Strong documentation skills and a structured approach to capturing change impacts and stakeholder needs

Confidence engaging with stakeholders at various levels

The ability to work in fast-paced, complex transformation environments

Excellent communication, organisation, and problem-solving skills

 Why Register Your Interest?

Be considered early for upcoming transformation roles

Opportunities across reputable Australian organisations

Competitive daily rate contracts and hybrid working arrangements

Work aligned to your experience, sector background, and availability

If you would like to be considered for upcoming Change Analyst opportunities, please submit your Expression of Interest.
